text: Hopea parviflora is a species of plant in the family Dipterocarpaceae. It is endemic to India. It is called 'kampakam' or 'thampakam' in Malayalam and கோங்கு 'vellaikongu' or 'irubogam' in Tamil. Hopea parviflora is a tree growing 30 – 37 metres tall. The bole can be 150 cm in diameter. The tree produces a beautiful timber and is commonly harvested from the wild, both for local use and for trade. The plant is classified as 'Endangered' in the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Flowers of Hopea parviflora with tender leaves. Image from Idayilekkad in Kasargodu, Kerala, India ==See also== * List of Indian timber trees ==References== parviflora Category:Endangered plants Category:Endemic flora of India (region) Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
